The UN’s international court of justice (ICJ) has ordered Israel to end its occupation of the Palestinian territories “as rapidly as possible”.

note: Writer and self-published author of novels and literary non-fiction. Presently labouring on my work in progress provisionally titled 'Innocence'. I'm an OAP, not odious and putrid but an old age pensioner living with my cat and best buddy Sparky.

The Citizen Lab is an interdisciplinary laboratory based at the Munk School of Global Affairs & Public Policy, University of Toronto, focusing on research, development, and high-level strategic policy and legal engagement at the intersection of information and communication technologies, human rights, and global security.

We use a “mixed methods” approach to research combining practices from political science, law, computer science, and area studies.

note:
Recent Twitter emigré, thinks incessantly about #pedagogy, #education and #equity, with frequent forays into other nonsense. Always looking for ways to take collective action. Reads, rides and runs about. Works in HE.she/her NTF/SFHEA.
ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0003-1553-4737

fields.name: I work
fields.value: at a UK university in student support, libraries, teaching, pedagogy and belonging. I focus on working collaboratively and towards a collective impact, so mostly you’ll hear me talk about what “we” are doing. (ORCID: https://orcid.org/0000-0003-1553-4737)

fields.name: I am curious about
fields.value: politics, art, gaming, pedagogy, teaching and whatever that cool thing is you are working on. Tell me about it! I spend a lot of time thinking about how identity, critical pedagogy, belonging and agency intersect.

fields.name: I advocate for
fields.value: inclusive practice and pedagogy, accessible teaching and materials, belonging with diginity and equity. And the chance to see all your amazing pet pictures.

fields.name: You’ll also hear me talk about
fields.value: my three kids, “the sports cob” (also know as Caesar the horse), sarcastic takes on current events, books, poetry, random RPGs and whatever else I am focusing on at the moment. Testing out also being on the SoTL instance to keep those toots focused there
